intro: Dysoxylum macranthum, commonly known as the large-leaf dysoxylum, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sterculiaceae and is characterized by its large, leathery leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in lowland forests. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological and horticultural contexts.
